document.description: Developer downloads for Bing controls, services and APIs.

product.content:
Incorporate the latest road maps and aerial views from Bing Maps into your Windows Store app using JavaScript, C#, C++, or Visual Basic. To get started, see the Bing Maps for Windows Store Apps Developer Guide.
Note: This SDK is part of a suite of Bing Maps controls and services.

Integrate speech recognition into your Windows 8 and 8.1 Store apps with the Speech Recognition Control. The control accepts voice input through the microphone and returns the recognized text to the application.
product.link: Subscribe to the Speech Recognition Control
Download the Speech Recognition Control (for Windows 8)
Download the Speech Recognition Control (for Windows 8.1)

product.content: Integrate Microsoft’s robust cloud-based optical character recognition (OCR) control that detects printed text from an image captured through the device camera into your Windows 8.1 app.

The Translator control gives the Windows 8.1 developer easy access to language translation services. After download and one-time authentication, you can simply place the "Bing Translator" control in your app, feed it a string to translate, and receive the translation.
Use advertising to monetize your applications while presenting a rich, engaging and immersive advertising experience to your users.

The Windows Phone Software Development Kit (SDK) includes all of the tools that you need to develop apps and games for Windows Phone. Download Windows Phone SDK to use Speech-to-Text and Text-to-Speech capabilities.
